headline.print_headline: Netherlands Is Country With Most Plentiful, Healthy Food: Oxfam
headline.main: Netherlands Is Country With Most Plentiful, Healthy Food: Oxfam

docs.lead_paragraph: The Netherlands nudged past France and Switzerland as the country with the most nutritious, plentiful and healthy food, while the United States and Japan failed to make it into the top 20, a new ranking released by Oxfam on Tuesday showed.
docs.snippet: The Netherlands nudged past France and Switzerland as the country with the most nutritious, plentiful and healthy food, while the United States and Japan failed to make it into the top 20, a new ranking released by Oxfam on Tuesday showed.

headline.print_headline: Food and Drink Marketing Common in Schools
headline.main: Food and Drink Marketing Common in Schools

docs.lead_paragraph: Most children and teenagers in the U.S. go to schools that have partnerships with food and drink companies, according to a new study.
docs.snippet: Most children and teenagers in the U.S. go to schools that have partnerships with food and drink companies, according to a new study.

headline.print_headline: First Lady Hits the Half-Century Mark on Friday
headline.main: First Lady Hits the Half-Century Mark on Friday

docs.lead_paragraph: Approaching a milestone birthday, Michelle Obama exuberantly describes herself as "50 and fabulous." She's celebrating already and a big birthday blowout is in the works for this weekend at the White House.
docs.snippet: Approaching a milestone birthday, Michelle Obama exuberantly describes herself as "50 and fabulous." She's celebrating already and a big birthday blowout is in the works for this weekend at the White House.

headline.main: New York Times Features Every Teacher Should Know About

byline.original: By KATHERINE SCHULTEN and MICHAEL GONCHAR

docs.abstract: Our list of lesser-known Times features that regularly yield rich material for teaching and learning, categorized by subject area. What would you add?
docs.snippet: Our list of lesser-known Times features that regularly yield rich material for teaching and learning, categorized by subject area. What would you add?

headline.print_headline: Promising Drug Trial Lifts Stock Of Company
headline.main: Promising Drug Trial Lifts Stock of Intercept

docs.abstract: Shares of Intercept Pharmaceuticals nearly quadruple to $275.87 after clinical trial suggests that drug maker might have the first effective treatment for a fatty liver disease associated with the nation’s epidemic of obesity; drug, called obeticholic acid, is a treatment for nonalcoholic steatohepatitis.
docs.lead_paragraph: The trial, which was cut short, showed that Intercept Pharmaceuticals might have a treatment for a fatty liver disease.
docs.snippet: The trial, which was cut short, showed that Intercept Pharmaceuticals might have a treatment for a fatty liver disease.

headline.print_headline: Food, Beverage Companies Slash Calories in Obesity Fight
headline.main: Food, Beverage Companies Slash Calories in Obesity Fight

docs.lead_paragraph: A voluntary effort by the world's largest food and beverage companies to remove billions of calories from the products they sell in the United States to help combat the nation's obesity epidemic has far exceeded its five-year goal, according to an independent evaluation released on Thursday.
docs.snippet: A voluntary effort by the world's largest food and beverage companies to remove billions of calories from the products they sell in the United States to help combat the nation's obesity epidemic has far exceeded its five-year goal, according to an...

headline.print_headline: Food Industry Cuts Calories Four-Fold Over Pledge
headline.main: Food Industry Cuts Calories Four-Fold Over Pledge

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the nation's largest food companies have cut daily calorie counts by an average of 78 per person, a new study says, more than four times the amount the industry pledged to slash by next year.
docs.snippet: Some of the nation's largest food companies have cut daily calorie counts by an average of 78 per person, a new study says, more than four times the amount the industry pledged to slash by next year.

headline.print_headline: Food Companies Have Cut Back on Calories, Study Says
headline.main: Food Companies Have Cut Back on Calories, Study Says

docs.abstract: Robert Wood Johnson Foundation study says 78 calories have been cut out of an American's daily diet as result of five-year reduction of calories, totaling 6.4 trillion, in sales of food and beverages by 16 major companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: A study found there were trillions of fewer calories in the foods sold by 16 large companies. But some were skeptical that corporate effort alone was the cause.
docs.snippet: A study found there were trillions of fewer calories in the foods sold by 16 large companies. But some were skeptical that corporate effort alone was the cause.

docs.abstract: Food news, straight from the polar vortex.
